bibl.title: Dative by genitive replacement in the Greek language of the papyri: a diachronic account of case semantics
bibl.seg: Joanne Vera Stolk, Dative by Genitive Replacement in the Greek Language of the Papyri: A Diachronic Account of Case Semantics.
Journal of Greek Linguistics 15 (2015) pp. 91-121, figg.

1. Introduction. - 2. Previous research. - 3. Theoretical background: 3.1. Possession constructions; - 3.2. Ditransitive constructions. - 4. Data and quantitative analysis: 4.1. Prenominal genitive constructions (GN); - 4.2. Phrasal enitive constructions (VG). - 5. Semantic analysis of the prenominal genitive: 5.1. The genitive as external possessor; - 5.2. The affected possessor; - 5.3. Affectedness and alienable possessors; - 5.4. Other genitive affectees. - 6. Semantic extension of the genitive case: 6.1. Genitive as benefactive and goal; - 6.2. The final stage of semantic extension. - 7. Conclusion.
